tokencover.settings.los-algorithm.Name: Target Algorithm
tokencover.settings.los-algorithm.Hint: How to test whether a target token has cover with respect to a viewing token.
tokencover.settings.los-percent.Name: Target Percent Threshold
tokencover.settings.los-percent.Hint: Percentage of the token hit area that must be viewable to another token to be considered visible by that other token. For points, this is the percentage of target points that must be visible. If set to 0, then if any part of the token (or any point) is viewable, it is considered visible.
tokencover.settings.los-large-target.Hin: If the target token is larger than the grid square, test each grid square under the token separately for cover. Least cover wins. Useful for large targets that should not have cover if the viewer has line-of-sight to a substantial portion of the target. When using the points algorithm, this generally follows the dnd5e DMG cover rule for grid squares.
tokencover.settings.los-points-viewer.Hi: How many points on the viewer to test for line-of-sight to the target. Each viewer point is considered independently; least cover wins. Beware that this can dramatically increase the number of tests needed to determine cover.
tokencover.settings.los-inset-viewer.Hin: For viewer points other than the center, what percentage to inset the point from the token border towards the token center.
tokencover.settings.los-points-target.Hi: How many points on the target to test for cover from the viewer's line-of-sight.
tokencover.settings.los-inset-target.Hin: For target points other than the center, what percentage to inset the point from the token border towards the token center.
tokencover.settings.los-points-3d.Name: Target 3d points
tokencover.settings.los-points-3d.Hint: Test the top and bottom of the target token in addition to the points in the middle of the token vertically.
tokencover.settings.debug-los.Name: Debug Cover
tokencover.settings.debug-los.Hint: If enabled, will draw representation on the canvas of the cover between viewer and target(s). If Area3d is enabled, you must target a single token to make the debug window appear.
tokencover.settings.cover-trigger-percen: If greater than or equal to this percent of the corners or token area (depending on algorithm) is not viewable, the token will have low cover.
If greater than or equal to this percent of the corners or token area (depending on algorithm) is not viewable, the token will have medium cover.
If greater than or equal to this percent of the corner or token area (depending on algorithm) is not viewable, the token will have high cover.
tokencover.settings.cover-trigger-center: When the line from one token center to another token center is blocked, use this cover type. (PF2e uses Medium, or Standard, cover.)
tokencover.settings.midiqol-covercheck.H: When rolling an attack in dnd5e with targeted tokens, should cover be applied automatically or require a confirmation dialog from the GM or user?
tokencover.settings.midiqol-covercheck-i: Only ask for cover attack workflow confirmation if the calculated cover varies from the current token status. Does nothing if cover attack workflow does not require confirmation.
tokencover.settings.cover-combat-auto.Hi: If in combat, when a user that owns the current combatant is targeting a token, apply cover effects to the targeted token based on cover from the current combatant.
tokencover.settings.cover-chat-message.H: When rolling an attack, test and display cover for targets in the chat. Currently only in dnd5e.
tokencover.settings.menu-cover-effects-h: Configure the label, icon, and active effects for cover. Settings are stored per system. Separate settings are stored when the midi-qol module is active. If DFred's Convenient Effects module is active, those status effects will be used instead.
tokencover.settings.cover-token-dead.Hin: Do dead or unconscious tokens grant cover? Set token to prone to give it half-cover when this setting is enabled.
tokencover.settings.cover-token-dead-att: String indicating where the hit points for a `token.actor` can be found. Required to use dead tokens for cover.
tokencover.settings.cover-prone.Name: Prone Tokens Grant Cover
tokencover.settings.cover-prone.Hint: If the dead/live token is prone and could otherwise be cover, should it be considered cover?
tokencover.settings.cover-token-live.Hin: 'Cover': Token shape contributes to cover. 'Forced': Flat low cover for tokens; token shape not otherwise considered (dnd5e/pf2e). No cover: Tokens do not contribute to cover.
tokencover.settings.cover-token-prone-at: String indicating the id for the token 'prone' status. If set, prone tokens will be considered half-height for all vision and cover calculations. Requires Wall Height module.
tokencover.settings.button-pf2e.Name: Change settings to
tokencover.settings.button-pf2e.Label: Reset to PF2e
tokencover.settings.button-pf2e.Notifica: Alt. Cover settings changed to PF2e defaults
tokencover.settings.button-dnd5e-dmg.Not: Alt. Cover settings changed to D&D 5e DMG defaults
tokencover.settings.button-three-d.Label: Reset to 3-D
tokencover.settings.button-three-d.Notif: Alt. Cover settings changed to 3D defaults
tokencover.DrawingConfiguration.isHole.H: For area algorithms, treat the space indicated by the drawing (including elevation) as a hole for tiles. Only applicable when Levels is active.
tokencover.dnd5e.feats.cover.Name: Ignore certain levels of cover
tokencover.dnd5e.feats.cover.Hint: Provided by feats and magic items.
